intro: Melchiora mannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette structure. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from white to pink and purple, and bloom in clusters. Melchiora mannii thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
